4.40.text: These people are amongst the greatest quiz players in Britain.

10.00.text: Together they make up the Eggheads,

11.88.text: arguably the most formidable quiz team in the country.

17.32.text: The question is, can they be beaten?

24.08.text: Welcome to Eggheads, the show where a team of five quiz Challengers

27.52.text: pit their wits against possibly the greatest quiz team in Britain.

33.08.text: And they're right here, the legends in person.

39.52.text: Never short of confidence, this lot.

43.28.text: of our quiz Goliaths are the...

47.20.text: Now, this team of old friends

48.44.text: and family have known one another for over 50 years

51.16.text: and they take their name from the 1960s TV safety campaign,

58.52.text: Hi, my name is John and I'm a UK sales manager.

61.76.text: Hi, my name is Jarl. I'm head of operations for a leisure trust.

65.52.text: Hi, my name is James. I'm a chiropractor.

68.92.text: Hi, I'm Ged and I'm a service delivery manager.

72.08.text: Hello, my name is Tony and I'm wholesale greengrocer.

76.32.text:
- John, team, welcome. Good to see you. 
- Thank you.

79.00.text: And Tufty the Squirrel, then. Was it a close personal friend or...?

82.92.text: Not particularly. It was a royal safety campaign, as you know,

85.88.text: from the 1960s and I can't say we were avid supporters of it,

89.36.text: but it was actually bestowed on us

90.84.text: by another contemporary as a bit of a mickey take.

93.48.text:
- But we take to it and we wear it as a badge of honour. 
- Badge of honour.

96.36.text: And I noticed you're all exactly...

99.24.text:
- 58 years old. 
- 58, yeah. We all grew up together.

101.60.text: Three of us are cousins - myself, Jarl and Jim. We are three cousins.

106.04.text:
- Yep. 
- Also, the other two guys, Ged and Tony,

108.08.text: also grew up on the same street.

109.48.text:
- We've known each other since we were...out of a cot. 
- OK.

111.92.text: So, we've stuck together and firm friends.

114.64.text: Well, good stuff. And you watch Eggheads, I'm presuming,

117.08.text:
- so you know what you are up against here. BOTH: 
- We do indeed.

119.68.text: A bit of road safety going on here, I think,

121.52.text: this lot is swerving all over the place.

123.36.text: They can be a bit dangerous.

124.92.text: Every day, there is £1,000 worth of cash up for grabs

127.60.text: for our Challengers, however, if they fail to defeat the Eggheads,

130.64.text: the prize money rolls over to the next show. You know that.

133.36.text: Tufty Club, I can tell you what you don't know is that they have

136.20.text: won the last 20. So, they are playing really well.

139.12.text: That's not good. What is good is

143.80.text:
- That is good. 
- That is good.

174.68.text: please take your positions in our Question Room.

254.56.text: ins and outs of it, but he...

255.88.text: I mean, he came to prominence

257.24.text: at a time when there was really

258.72.text: vicious infighting between the two main political factions,
